SEARCH
Package com.sgware.serialsoc

Class SerialServerSocket

java.lang.Object
com.sgware.serialsoc.SerialServerSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
CheckedRunnable, AutoCloseable, Callable<Void>
public class SerialServerSocket extends Object implements CheckedRunnable, AutoCloseable
A wrapper around ServerSocket that accepts new SerialSockets and ensures all events happen on the same thread.

When run() is called, all of the following events will happen on the thread which called that run():

  • createServer() will be called to bind a ServerSocket. If that method throws an exception, it is thrown immediately and no other events will happen.
  • onStart is called exactly once and before any other events.
  • Each time the server socket accepts a new connection, createSocket(java.net.Socket) will be called to make a new instance of SerialSocket.
  • When the server is closed, either because close() was called, because the thread was interrupted, because the server socket was disconnected, or because an uncaught exception was thrown, onClose is called exactly once. Then all open sockets will also be closed.
  • After all other events, onStop is called exactly once.
  • If at any time an uncaught exception is thrown, onException is called immediately, then the server will close and stop, and then, after all events have finished, the uncaught exception will be thrown by run(). If more than one uncaught exception is thrown, onException will be called for all of them, but only the first uncaught exception will be thrown by run().

If an operation needs to run on the same thread as these events but not in response to an event (such as a regular tick or status check) any thread can use execute(CheckedRunnable) to submit an operation to be run on the main thread.

Version:
1
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Constructor Details

    • SerialServerSocket

      public SerialServerSocket()
      Constructs a new serial server socket. The server socket is not created or bound until run() is called.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public final void run() throws Exception
      Description copied from interface: CheckedRunnable
      Perform the operation, possibly throwing an exception in the process.
      Specified by:
      run in interface CheckedRunnable
      Throws:
      Exception - if the operation threw an exception

    • close

      public void close()

      Begins the process of stopping the server. After this method is called, onClose() will run on the main thread, all open sockets will be closed, and the server will eventually stop.

      It is safe to call this method from any thread; it does not need to be called from the main thread.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable

    • createServer

      protected ServerSocket createServer() throws Exception
      Bind and return a ServerSocket. This method is called once at the start of run().

      By default, this method is equivalent to:

      return new ServerSocket(0);

      Overriding this method allows the server to be configured. For example, it can be bound to a specific port, or a subclass of ServerSocket can be returned, such as SSLServerSocket.

      Returns:
      a bound server socket on which this server will listen for new connections
      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception occurs while creating or binding the server socket

    • createSocket

      protected SerialSocket createSocket(Socket socket) throws Exception
      Create an instance of SerialSocket from a Socket accepted by this server.

      By default, this method is equivalent to:

      return new SerialSocket(this, socket);

      Overriding this method allows the socket to be configured. For example, a subclass of SerialSocket can be returned, or an SSLSocket can perform its handshake.

      Parameters:
      socket - the socket to used when creating a SerialSocket
      Returns:
      an instance of SerialSocket
      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception occurs when creating the SerialSocket

    • createReader

      protected BufferedReader createReader(Socket socket) throws Exception
      Creates an instance of BufferedReader to read from a Socket.

      By default, this method is equivalent to:

      return new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(socket.getInputStream()));

      Overriding this method allows the reader to be configured. For example, the reader could be configured to limit the maximum amount of input to read to avoid an out of memory attack.

      Parameters:
      socket - the socket whose input should be read from
      Returns:
      a BufferedReader on the socket's input
      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception occurs while creating the reader

    • createWriter

      protected BufferedWriter createWriter(Socket socket) throws Exception
      Creates an instance of BufferedWriter to write to a Socket.

      By default, this method is equivalent to:

      return new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(socket.getOutputStream()));

      Overriding this method allows the writer to be configured. For example, the writer could be given a larger or smaller buffer size.

      Parameters:
      socket - the socket whose output should be written to
      Returns:
      a BufferedWriter for the socket's output
      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception occurs while creating the writer

    • getServerSocket

      protected ServerSocket getServerSocket()
      Returns the ServerSocket this server is using, or throws an exception if it has not yet been bound.
      Returns:
      the server socket
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if createSocket(Socket) has not yet been called to create and bind the server socket

    • execute

      protected void execute(CheckedRunnable runnable)
      Runs an an operation on the main thread which called run(). This method can be used when an operation needs to run on the same thread as the server's events but not in response to one of those events.
      Parameters:
      runnable - an operation to fun on the main thread

    • onStart

      protected void onStart() throws Exception
      This method runs exactly once on the main thread after the server socket has been created and bound and before all other events.

      By default, this method does nothing. It is meant to be overridden.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception is thrown by the method

    • onException

      protected void onException(Exception exception) throws Exception
      This method runs on the main thread when an uncaught exception is thrown on the main thread. This method runs immediately after the exception is thrown. It provides an opportunity to log the exception. After an uncaught exception is thrown, the server is closed and begins to shut down. After the server stops, the first uncaught exception will be thrown from run(), but if any other uncaught exceptions occur while the server is shutting down, they will each be passed to this method.

      By default, this method does nothing. It is meant to be overridden.

      It is strongly recommended that this method not throw an exception. If it does, that exception will be caught and printed to standard error, but it will not be reported to this method to avoid creating an infinite loop.

      Parameters:
      exception - the uncaught exception
      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception is thrown by the method

    • onClose

      protected void onClose() throws Exception
      This method runs exactly once on the main thread when the server is closed, which can happen when the close() method is called, when the main thread is interrupted, when the server socket is disconnected, or when an uncaught exception is thrown on the main thread. After this event, the server will close all open sockets and eventually stop.

      By default, this method does nothing. It is meant to be overridden.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception is thrown by the method

    • onStop

      protected void onStop() throws Exception
      This method is called exactly once after all other events. All open sockets will have been closed and disconnected before this method is called. This method provides an opportunity for cleanup.

      By default, this method does nothing. It is meant to be overridden.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an exception is thrown by the method
